purpose: The email announces three upcoming full-time faculty positions in the Computer Science department at UCLouvain, Belgium, specifically targeting candidates in software engineering and security. It encourages recipients to forward the information to high-profile candidates seeking permanent positions at a prestigious university in Europe. The positions are open to all seniority levels and highlight the benefits of working at UCLouvain, including a vibrant work environment, excellent research infrastructure, and competitive salaries. Interested candidates are invited to contact the department chair for more information before the official job postings are made in early September.

evidence_sentences: The Computer Science department at UCLouvain (Belgium) will soon open three full-time faculty positions targeting excellent profiles in the following domains.
Positions 1 and 2, in one or more of these areas: Software engineering, Programming systems and languages, Software dependability, including formal methods.
Position 3, in software security and cybersecurity, also broadly construed.
The three positions will be open to all seniority levels (assistant/associate or full).
A vibrant work environment just south of Brussels.
Moderate teaching load and access to excellent students.
No need to speak French to apply (but willingness to learn in a few years if appointed).
We expect vacancies to be announced on the UCLouvain job portal in early September.
Interested potential candidates are welcome to contact the department chair at [log in to unmask] with any questions.
